meanings.definition: A heavy woolen double-breasted jacket worn by sailors.
meanings.sent1: The sailor put on his warm peacoat before heading out to sea.
meanings.sent2: She bought a new peacoat to stay cozy during the winter.
meanings.sent3: The peacoat looked so big on the tiny kitten, making everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: His peacoat was like a shield against the biting wind on the cliff.
meanings.sent5: The bright red peacoat stood out in the sea of black jackets.

meanings.definition: A short coat made of this fabric.
meanings.sent1: During the chilly evening, she wrapped herself in a soft peacoat.
meanings.sent2: He admired the classic style of her navy blue peacoat.
meanings.sent3: The peacoat was so snug that she felt like a warm burrito.
meanings.sent4: Her peacoat was a symbol of elegance and sophistication.
meanings.sent5: The peacoat's rich navy color reminded him of the deep ocean.
